meanings.definition: In a learned or knowledgeable manner.
meanings.sent1: She spoke learnedly about the history of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: He answered the question learnedly, impressing everyone with his knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the bookshelf learnedly, as if contemplating which book to read next.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled learnedly in the night sky, as if sharing their wisdom with the world.
meanings.sent5: The old professor nodded learnedly, acknowledging the insightful comment.

meanings.definition: Showing or possessing knowledge acquired through study or experience.
meanings.sent1: The learnedly student aced the difficult exam with ease.
meanings.sent2: She gave a learnedly presentation on the topic, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl looked learnedly at the curious squirrel, ready to share its knowledge.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tree stood learnedly in the forest, its branches whispering tales of the past.
meanings.sent5: The experienced detective examined the crime scene learnedly, piecing together the clues.
